The response curves (GAMs) of Abies, Ulmus, Fraxinus excelsior-t. and Tilia to microscopic charcoal influx provide compelling evidence about the sensitivity of these trees to increasing fire activity (Figures 4A, S4A; Table 1). Our data also suggest that Corylus responded negatively to light or moderate fire activity, whereas it was favored by high regional burning (Figures 4A, S4A; Table 1). In contrast, light to moderate fires likely boosted Fagus but high fire activity affected it negatively (Figures 4A, S4A; but note the moderate robustness of the model, Table 1).
